alert.note: Alert for Boone (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 07 at 3:06PM CDT until May 13 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN STORY...NORTHWESTERN MARSHALL...SOUTHERN HARDIN... SOUTHEASTERN HAMILTON AND EASTERN BOONE COUNTIES... At 306 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Roland, or 9 miles north of Nevada, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... McCallsburg and Garden City around 315 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Zearing, St. Anthony and Clemons. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 113 and 130. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
